newsitem.title: PERU: Peru sells two fish plants for $14.5 million.
newsitem.headline: Peru sells two fish plants for $14.5 million.

text.p: The Peruvian government on Friday sold two fish oil and fishmeal plants for $14.5 million to local companies, privatization officials said.
Pesquera Rubio won the auction of state fishing company Pesca Peru's Ilo Sur plant for $7.5 million, while Hayduck bought the Ilo Norte unit for $7.04 million.
Pesca Peru is in the midddle of a piecemeal privatization process.
